title: What are some Chinese inventions? Does someone have a list? - Quora

response.answer_text: Besides the 4 scientific inventions - Gun Powder, Compass, Paper, Printing - which were passed down to the 16CE European Renaissance via the 13 CE Arabs (who were chased westwards by the Mongolians), there are few more great inventions uniquely Chinese : TCM Traditional Chinese Medicine: Acupuncture 针灸, Herbal Pharmacy 中药, Qi-gong 气功Martial Art: Shaolin Kongfu, TaijiCuisine: Wok invented in 11CE (Song dynasty) to fry (炒 : Chinese invented cooking technique ) food quickly using minimum coal fuel. The Mongolian Army conquered Central Asia to Europe with astonishing speed because the soldiers each carried a wok on the horse back, during maneuvers anytime anywhere they could prepare food.Fireworks 烟花Meritocratic Imperial Exams System (科举) from 6CE (隋朝) till 1900AD (清末) to select civil servants from ordinary citizens, regardless of family background. French Emperor Napoléon copied it as the French “Concours” for Engineering University “Grandes Écoles” till today.Government Administrative System: Various Ministries (Defence, Law, Organisation, etc ) run by Mandarin officials of different ranks … this was copied by the Korean, Vietnamese and British Civil Service.Architecture Fengshui (风水) aka Geomancy : although some elements are criticised as superstitions, it influenced the major architectures like Forbidden Palace, temples, tombs, monuments, etc.Math : Yin / Yang binary system (today 0/1 computer boolean algebra).Computing tool: Abacus.Art: Chinese calligraphy 书法。

China was the first nation on the planet to make appropriate paper. The invention of papermaking is one of China's critical commitments to the spread and the improvement of human progress. As indicated by exploration, paper was first made amid the Western Han Dynasty successfully concocted the world's first group of paper utilizing fish nets, tree rind, bits of rope and clothes. Before paper was imagined, the antiquated Chinese cut characters on stoneware, creature bones and stones, cast them in bronzes, or kept in touch with them on bamboo or wooden strips and silk fabric. These materials, be that as it may, were either too overwhelming or two costly for across the board use. The invention and utilization of paper acquired an insurgency composing and made ready for the invention of printing technology.
